items.name: Data for USGS Award G20A_00049 - Evaluating outer-rise earthquake hazards from the Puerto Rico Trench by calibrating inundation models with geologic evidence
items.description: The project data for USGS Award No. G20AP00049 “Evaluating outer-rise earthquake hazards from the Puerto Rico Trench by calibrating inundation models with geologic evidence” is composed of four components: deposits, DEMs, model grids, and model results. 1. The “Deposits” folder includes csv files for 10 types of deposits disclosed on Anegada in csv format, with their details provided by the metadata in the same folder. 2. The “DEMs” folder consists of four subfolders. The details of these DEMs are provided in Table S1 in the report. • NCEI_1arcsec_MHW: original dataset at the grid resolution of 1 arc sec in ascii format derived from the National Center for Environmental Information (NCEI) for U.S. Virgin Islands • BVI topo/bathy: British Virgin Islands bathymetry and topography obtained from the BVI Department of Disaster Management • Lidar_survey: The USGS Lidar-derived seamless (Bare Earth and submerged) point cloud for coastal topography – Anegada, British Virgin Islands, 2014, doi.org/10.5066/F7GM85F3 (https://data.usgs.gov/datacatalog/data/USGS:093b07ed-88ac-4bbe-9aec-cc98de4170c1). A metadata file for this dataset is provided in the same folder. • PR_Trench_150m: Bathymetric Terrain Model of the Puerto Rico Trench and Northeastern Caribbean Region Compiled by the U.S. Geological Survey From Multibeam Bathymetric Data Collected Between 2002 and 2013 (PRBATHOFR150, Esri Binary Grid, UTM19, WGS 84). Available at https://data.usgs.gov/datacatalog/data/USGS:85398e9e-5e1e-4c5d-b835-5c4cf11e21bc 3. The “Model_grids” folder includes model grids for Tsunami (subfolder “Tsunami”) and Hurricane (subfolder “Hurricane”) modeling developed through the present study. All grid files are formatted in netcdf format. The subfolder “Tsunami” has the model grids for Anegada, San Juan, and St Thomas Folder “Anegada”: • Propagation grid: atlantic_2min_GEBCO.nc. This grid is specifically used for computing the transatlantic tsunami propagation due to the 1755 Lisbon M9.0 scenario. o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -79.0 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: 19.0 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 71.0 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: -19.0 o Grid spatial resolution: 2 arc min o Data source: GEneral Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO) https://www.gebco.net/ • Propagation grid: PR_30sec.nc. This grid is specifically used for computing the transatlantic tsunami propagation from the earthquake scenarios in the Puerto Rico Trench. o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -69.0 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -60.0 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 21.0 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 16.5 o Grid spatial resolution: 30 arc sec • MOST A grid: anegada_6sec.nc. This grid is used in the A level of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -65.15 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -64.2 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.9 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.2 o Grid spatial resolution: 6 arc sec • MOST B grid: anegada_1sec.nc. This grid is used in the B level of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -64.44 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -64.24 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.85 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.65 o Grid spatial resolution: 1 arc sec • MOST C grid: anegada_10m.nc. This grid is the C grid of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -64.43 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -64.25 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.77 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.68 o Grid spatial resolution: 1/3 arc sec Folder “SanJuan”: • MOST A grid: rim_gridA_20sec.nc. This grid is used in the A level of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -69.9 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -60.50401401 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.95 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 16.0555556 o Grid spatial resolution: 20 arc sec • MOST B grid: rim_gridB_6sec.nc. This grid is used in the B level of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -67.4 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -65.2 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.6 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 17.8 o Grid spatial resolution: 1 arc sec • MOST C grid: anegada_10m.nc. This grid is the C grid of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -66.188889 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -65.975 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.5 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.375 o Grid spatial resolution: 1/3 arc sec Folder “StThomas”: • MOST A grid: East_Caribbean_21p333sec.nc. This grid is used in the A level of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -67.565601784215005 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -61.473750102935014 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 19.032638864735 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 16.620787080415 o Grid spatial resolution: 21.333 arc sec • MOST B grid: USVI_North2p667sec.nc. This grid is used in the B level of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -65.144490740894980 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -64.517083351055021 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.537453693415 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.194490740055 o Grid spatial resolution: 2.667 arc sec • MOST C grid: anegada_10m.nc. This grid is the C grid of MOST o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -65.068518520800012 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -64.810185194700011 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.38740740132 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 18.28824073743 o Grid spatial resolution: 1/3 arc sec The subfolder “Hurricane” has the model grids for NEOWAVE_Surge, SWAN, and BOSZ, which are different models used to compute regional and local wave conditions and inundation impact. Folder “NEOWAVE_Surge”: Level-1 grid: depth_grid_1.dat. This file is a matrix of water depth data o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -68.0 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -54 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 21.0 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 15.0 o Grid spatial resolution: 1 arc min Folder “SWAN”: • Level-1 grid: depth_grid_1.dat. This file is a matrix of water depth data o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -68.0 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -54 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 21.0 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 15.0 o Grid spatial resolution: 1 arc min • Level-2 grid: depth_grid_2.dat. This file is a matrix of water depth data o West_Boundaing_Coordinates: -64.6 o East_Bounding_Coordinates: -64.2 o North_Bounding_Coordinates: 21.0 o South_Bounding_Coordinates: 20.75 o Grid spatial resolution: 6 arc sec Folder “BOSZ”: • Deepbay_10m.mat. This is a grid file specifically required by BOSZ model, based on Cartesian grid and saved in Matlab .mat format. This file is used for all hypothetical hurricane track scenarios. o Grid spatial resolution: 10 m • Deepbay_5m.mat. This is a grid file specifically required by BOSZ model, based on Cartesian grid and saved in Matlab .mat format. This file is used for 2017 Irma hurricane model validation. o Grid spatial resolution: 5 m 4. The “Model_results” folder includes the computational model results for Tsunami (subfolder “tsunami_modeling”) and Hurricane (subfolder “hurricane_modeling”) modeling developed through the present study. All grid files are formatted in netcdf format. • The subfolder “tsunami_modeling” includes model results in netcdf format with all variables and attributes explained in each netcdf file. The first two parts of the file name correspond to the source scenarios given in Table 2 of the report. • The subfolder “hurricane modeling” includes the modeled hurricane track data and the inundation results for 2017 Irma (subfolder “Irma”) and the hypothetical hurricane scenarios. Folder “Irma”: • Irma_track.inp: track information of the Hurricane Irma o The waypoint time stamp (YYMMDDHHMM) o Latitude: Latidude of the hurricane center. A positive latitude indicates north, and a negative latitude indicates south. o Longitude: Longitude of the hurricane center. A positive longitude indicates west, and a negative latitude indicates east. o Wind speed: The maximum sustained wind speed in knots o Air pressure: The pressure at the hurricane center in hPa o Radius of sustained wind speed in (km) o The shape parameter in the modified Rankine wind model. • Subfolder “gauge_data”: text data files of tidal observations at Croix, Culebra, San Juan, and St. John during the 2017 Irma hurricane • Subfolder “buoy_data”: text data files of wave conditions recorded on buoys 41040, 41043, 41044, 42060, and 9765115. • Subfolder “BOSZ_model_results”: inundation modeling data for 2017 Hurricane Irma computed from BOSZ o BOTC.bosz: matrix of bathymetry/topography data o X.mat: matrix of longitude data o Y.mat: matrix with latitude data o Hstmp.mat: max significant wave height at every computational grid o MaxRtmp.mat: matrix of maximum free surface elevation during model run o MaxUVtemp.mat: matrix for maximum flow speed from the resultant velocity o STPtemp.mat: matrix for wave setup (mean water level over the entire domain) o SWN_20170906162000.spect: the spectrum output from SWAN computation at the time of 16:20:00 09/06, 2019 when the storm surge level reaches the highest throughout the computation. Folder “hypotherical_hurricane_tracks”: • Subfolder “Track_data”: information for each hypothetical hurricane track including: o The waypoint time stamp (YYMMDDHHMM) o Latitude: Latidude of the hurricane center. A positive latitude indicates north, and a negative latitude indicates south. o Longitude: Longitude of the hurricane center. A positive longitude indicates west, and a negative latitude indicates east. o Wind speed: The maximum sustained wind speed in knots o Air pressure: The pressure at the hurricane center in hPa o Radius of sustained wind speed in (km) o The shape parameter in the modified Rankine wind model. • Subfolder: “BOSZ_model_results_track4”: inundation modeling data for the hypothetical hurricane track #4 computed from BOSZ o BOTC.bosz: matrix of bathymetry/topography data o X.mat: matrix of longitude data o Y.mat: matrix with latitude data o Hstmp.mat: max significant wave height at every computational grid o MaxRtmp.mat: matrix of maximum free surface elevation during model run o MaxUVtemp.mat: matrix for maximum flow speed from the resultant velocity o STPtemp.mat: matrix for wave setup (mean water level over the entire domain) o SWN_20170906162000.spect: the spectrum output from SWAN computation at the time of 16:20:00 09/06, 2019 when the storm surge level reaches the highest throughout the computation.
